result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply.

miscConds.notes:
*  Submit a DNA sample/pay DNA surcharge.
*  Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
*  No contact with any firearms of any kind.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet

Defendant James M Smith in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial, however, court will be in trial on another matter. Case adjourned.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Jury trial scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed with court.
State's Witness List received and filed with court.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed with court.
Defendant James M Smith in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel appearing by authorization for today's proceedings only. 
Motion for severance filed by State.  Defense no objection.  Court grants State's motion for severance. Final pretrial held.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 3-07-2016 at 8:30 am.  All parties are advised effective February 1, 2016 this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 04, Room 515 of the Courthouse.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.
State's Motion for Severance, received and filed.
Defendant's Authorization For Attorney To Appear and Act received and filed with court.

Defendant James M Smith in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James M Smith in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for a status conference case. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Notice of Retainer and Cover Letter.

Defendant James M Smith in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set over for a status confernece on 9/1/2015 to allow co-defendant cases to be heard with this matter. Case adjourend to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James M Smith in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Student Intern Morgan Wilz under the supervision of  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant requests additional time to obtain private counsel.  Court grants request.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515. Defendant James M Smith in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-06-2015

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-06-2015

Bail continued as previously set.   
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James M Smith in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/8/15 @ 1:30pm
